revision.text:
{{Wiktionary|deduction}} '''Deduction''' may refer to:
==Philosophy== * [[Deductive reasoning]], inference in which the conclusion is of no greater generality than the premises * [[Natural deduction]], an approach to proof theory that attempts to provide a formal model of logical reasoning as it "naturally" occurs * [[Logic and rationality|Logical thinking ]]
==Taxation== * [[Tax deduction]], variable tax dollars subtracted, (or ''deducted'',) from gross income. ** [[Itemized deduction]], eligible expense that individual taxpayers in the United States can report on their Federal income tax returns ** [[Standard deduction]], dollar amount that non-itemizers may subtract from their income
==Other uses== * [[English modals of deduction]], English modal verbs to state how sure somebody is about something. * [[Deduction (food stamps)]], (in the USA) used to calculate a householdâ€™s monthly food stamp benefit goods
{{Disambiguation}}
